query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Quanto tra l’ultimar de l’ora terza 2 e ’l principio del dì par de la spera 3 che sempre a guisa di fanciullo scherza,
4 tanto pareva già inver’ la sera 5 essere al sol del suo corso rimaso; 6 vespero là, e qui mezza notte era.
query.result:
**English:**
1 As much time as there is between the end of the third hour 2 and the beginning of the day seems to the sphere 3 that always plays like a child,
4 so much time seemed to have already passed towards evening 5 for the sun in its course; 6 it was vespers there, and here it was midnight.
**Cornish:**
1 Kement eur a wra ynter diwedh an tresves our 2 ha pennarth an jydh a wra dhe’n sper 3 henna a wra pub prys avel flogh byghan,
4 kemmys o eur a wra tremen dhe’n nos 5 dhe’n howl dhe’n eur a wra dhe’n howl hy gours; 6 aberow o wra ena, ha hanow o wra hanter nos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E i raggi ne ferien per mezzo ’l naso, 8 perché per noi girato era sì ’l monte, 9 che già dritti andavamo inver’ l’occaso,
10 quand’ io senti’ a me gravar la fronte 11 a lo splendore assai più che di prima, 12 e stupor m’eran le cose non conte;
13 ond’ io levai le mani inver’ la cima 14 de le mie ciglia, e fecimi ’l solecchio, 15 che del soverchio visibile lima.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And the rays struck us in the face, 8 because the mountain had turned so much for us, 9 that we were already going straight towards the west,
10 when I felt my forehead being weighed down 11 by the brightness much more than before, 12 and I was amazed by the unknown things;
13 so I raised my hands to the top 14 of my eyebrows, and made myself a sunshade, 15 which lessens the excess of what is visible.
**Cornish:**
7 Ha’y sklerow a’n daras orth pub tronnadhow, 8 rag orth an menydh o wra treylyes dhe’n beyn, 9 pub o wra ow tos ow tos dhe’n west,
10 pan vynnav vy ow tal dhe vos pyskys 11 gans an sklerder moy ages vy kyns, 12 ha syndys o wra dhe’n traow na’n gwyskys;
13 rag henna vy a dhueth ow dew dhe’n ughella 14 a’m dewlagow, ha gwrellogh vy dhe’n howl, 15 henna a wra leha an gwella gweladow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Come quando da l’acqua o da lo specchio 17 salta lo raggio a l’opposita parte, 18 salendo su per lo modo parecchio
19 a quel che scende, e tanto si diparte 20 dal cader de la pietra in igual tratta, 21 sì come mostra esperïenza e arte;
22 così mi parve da luce rifratta 23 quivi dinanzi a me esser percosso; 24 per che a fuggir la mia vista fu ratta.
query.result:
**English:**
16 As when from the water or from the mirror 17 the ray leaps to the opposite side, 18 rising upwards in a path equal
19 to that which it descends, and departs as much 20 from the fall of the stone in equal distance, 21 as experience and art show;
22 so it seemed to me that I was struck 23 there in front of me by reflected light; 24 because of which my sight was quick to flee.
**Cornish:**
16 Dell yw pan a’n dowr po dhe’n fordh 17 an skler a wra dalleth dhe’n tu duy, 18 ow tos dhe’n ughella avel an fordh
19 dhe’n henna a wra dalleth, ha kemmys a wra 20 a’y skila dhe’n men, yn ughel an keth, 21 dell a wra diskwedhes gans arbennek ha arta;
22 dell wra dhe’n skler a wra dalleth orth vy 23 ena ow tos dhe’n beyn vy, 24 rag henna ow golwg a wra dalleth dhe floya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 «Che è quel, dolce padre, a che non posso 26 schermar lo viso tanto che mi vaglia», 27 diss’ io, «e pare inver’ noi esser mosso?».
query.result:
**English:**
25 "What is that, sweet father, from which I cannot 26 shield my sight enough to avail me", 27 I said, "and it seems to be moving towards us?".
**Cornish:**
25 "Pyth yw henna, ker tas, na’n gallam 26 gwitha ow golwg dhe’n beyn vy", 27 vy a leveris, "ha’n wra dalleth dhe’n beyn vy?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 «Non ti maravigliar s’ancor t’abbaglia 29 la famiglia del cielo», a me rispuose: 30 «messo è che viene ad invitar ch’om saglia.
query.result: **English:**28"Don't be surprised if the family of heaven29still dazzles you," he replied to me:30"a messenger has come to invite you to ascend."**Cornish:**28"Na wra vydh marghas ow pyw ty'th abaga,29teulu an nef," owth ev dhemm dh'ym,30"kannas yw bos dhe dh'y dhaskel dhe saglya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Tosto sarà ch’a veder queste cose 32 non ti fia grave, ma fieti diletto 33 quanto natura a sentir ti dispuose».
query.result: **English:**31Soon you will see these things32and it will not be difficult for you, but you will delight33as much as nature has prepared you to feel.**Cornish:**31Yn skon a vydh pan wely ow tosow,32na vydh poen dh'ydh, mes vydh lowen,33kemmys yma gonys naturel dhe'th bos dhe vos.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: **English:**34Then we reached the blessed angel,35who said with a joyful voice: "Enter here36onto a stairway less steep than the others."**Cornish:**34Wosa dhaskel dh'y'n dhe'n angel bennak,35gans lowen dowr ow leverel: "Dowr ama,36war an garrow vyth vy es le ages erys."

46 Per ch’elli a me: «Di sua maggior magagna 47 conosce il danno; e però non s’ammiri 48 se ne riprende perché men si piagna.

query.result:

**Cornish:**58"My yw moyha dhe vos kontent moyha digiwn,"59owth ow, "pyw ow vos tasek kyns owth kyns,60ha moyha a dhiskwedh moyha dowt y'n menes."

query.prompt:

61 Com’ esser puote ch’un ben, distributo 62 in più posseditor, faccia più ricchi 63 di sé che se da pochi è posseduto?».
query.result:

**Cornish:**61Kemmys yw bos pyw ben, dystribuys,62ynter moyha possesythoryow, a wra moyha golla63a-dhi es pyw ow yw possessith gans moyha?

64 Ed elli a me: «Però che tu rificchi 65 la mente pur a le cose terrene, 66 di vera luce tenebre dispicchi.
query.result:
**English:**

**Cornish:**
64 Ha henna dhym: "Mes rag omma whel 65 an poyntow pur dhe'n traowow an bys, 66 a-dhywgh golow a-dhiworth golow gwir."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Quello infinito e ineffabil bene 68 che là sù è, così corre ad amore 69 com’ a lucido corpo raggio vene.
query.result:
**English:**
67 That infinite and ineffable good 68 which is up there, runs to love 69 as a ray comes to a shining body.
**Cornish:**
67 An gwir dhiskwedhes ha diworth pub tra, 68 henna sywgh usi yn kerdhes dhe'n karanteth, 69 dell yw golwg dhe'n korf skler.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Tanto si dà quanto trova d’ardore; 71 sì che, quantunque carità si stende, 72 cresce sovr’ essa l’etterno valore.
query.result:
**English:**
70 It gives itself as much as it finds of ardor; 71 so that, however much charity extends, 72 the eternal value grows above it.
**Cornish:**
70 Kemmys a ro dhynnergh a garanteth, 71 pub tra, karanteth a dheuth dhe'n golwg, 72 an gwir dhiskwedhes a dyv dhe'n ughella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 E quanta gente più là sù s’intende, 74 più v’è da bene amare, e più vi s’ama, 75 e come specchio l’uno a l’altro rende.
query.result:
**English:**
73 And the more people who understand up there, 74 the more good there is to love, and the more they love each other, 75 and like a mirror, one reflects the other.
**Cornish:**
73 Ha moy a dus a dheuth dhe'n golwg usi, 74 moy a wra dhe'n karanteth dhe'n golwg, ha moy a wra an karanteth usi, 75 ha dell yw golwg, an eyl a wra dhe'n golwg dhe'n aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Ivi mi parve in una visïone 86 estatica di sùbito esser tratto, 87 e vedere in un tempio più persone;
88 e una donna, in su l’entrar, con atto 89 dolce di madre dicer: «Figliuol mio, 90 perché hai tu così verso noi fatto?
91 Ecco, dolenti, lo tuo padre e io 92 ti cercavamo». E come qui si tacque, 93 ciò che pareva prima, dispario.
query.result:
**English:**
85 There, in a vision, I seemed to be 86 suddenly transported in ecstasy, 87 and to see more people in a temple;
88 and a woman, at the entrance, with the 89 gentle manner of a mother, said: "My son, 90 why have you done this to us?
91 Behold, your father and I, grieved, 92 have been searching for you." And when she fell silent, 93 what had seemed real before, vanished.
**Cornish:**
85 Eno, yn onen visyon, me a semedh 86 yn sydynsek dreusys dhe gollys, 87 ha gweles moy person yn onen tempel;
88 Ha onen benyn, war an myns, gans onen 89 gwella dowr a vamm, ow leverel: "Va mab, 90 peragath vos owth ow thueth hemma?
91 Sel, yn dolurus, dha das ha my 92 a'th hwilas." Ha pan wrug hi tewi, 93 an peth a semedh kyns, a dhegwedhes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Indi m’apparve un’altra con quell’ acque 95 giù per le gote che ’l dolor distilla 96 quando di gran dispetto in altrui nacque,
97 e dir: «Se tu se’ sire de la villa 98 del cui nome ne’ dèi fu tanta lite, 99 e onde ogne scïenza disfavilla,
100 vendica te di quelle braccia ardite 101 ch’abbracciar nostra figlia, o Pisistràto».
query.result:
**English:**
94 Then another appeared to me, with those tears 95 streaming down her cheeks that grief distils 96 when great disdain is born in someone else,
97 and she said: "If you are lord of the city 98 whose name caused such strife among the gods, 99 and from which all knowledge radiates,
100 avenge yourself on those bold arms 101 that embraced our daughter, O Pisistratus."
**Cornish:**
94 Wosa henna, onen aral a semedh dhym 95 gans an dowrow war hy gosegow, an hyn a dhreus 96 pan voos dowr bras yn erel a dheuth,
97 ha leverel: "Magen syw ty a'n dre 98 an hanow a veu kemmys a stryf y'n mysk an dewow, 99 ha le mayth oll dyskans a dheudhyth,
100 gowdh dhe dhys a'n breghysow heb dowt 101 a gavasow ow mergh, O Pisistratus."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
102 E ’l segnor mi parea, benigno e mite,
103 risponder lei con viso temperato: 104 «Che farem noi a chi mal ne disira, 105 se quei che ci ama è per noi condannato?»,
106 Poi vidi genti accese in foco d’ira 107 con pietre un giovinetto ancider, forte 108 gridando a sé pur: «Martira, martira!».
query.result:
**English:**
102 And the lord seemed to me, gentle and mild,
103 to answer her with a composed countenance: 104 "What shall we do to those who wish us ill, 105 if those who love us are condemned by us?"
106 Then I saw people inflamed with the fire of wrath 107 stoning a young man to death, shouting loudly 108 to each other: "Kill him, kill him!"
**Cornish:**
102 Ha'n argluydh a semedh dhym, dowr ha melyn,
103 owth atteb hy gans onen edhom temperys: 104 "Pyw a wra ny a dhesir drok dhe ni, 105 mar an re a garo ni yw gonnys gans ni?",
106 Wosa henna, me a welas pobel tanow 107 gans tan mes yn laddhas onen yowynk, yn fordh 108 owth galwes dhe'n beu: "Mardhya, mardhya!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 E lui vedea chinarsi, per la morte 110 che l’aggravava già, inver’ la terra, 111 ma de li occhi facea sempre al ciel porte,
112 orando a l’alto Sire, in tanta guerra, 113 che perdonasse a’ suoi persecutori, 114 con quello aspetto che pietà diserra.
query.result:
**English:**
109 And I saw him bow down, as death 110 was already weighing him down, towards the earth, 111 but his eyes were always turned to heaven,
112 praying to the Lord on high, in such strife, 113 to forgive his persecutors, 114 with that countenance that unlocks pity.
**Cornish:**
109 Ha my a'n welas owth omglewya, rag an marow 110 a veu owth pyskweyth ev, dhe'n bys, 111 mes y'n ogasow a veu dhe'n nef poos,
112 owth pedhi dhe'n Arluydh Ughel, yn kemmys stryf, 113 dhe bardhoni dhe'y erbysoryon, 114 gans an edhom henna a dhegor pytas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Quando l’anima mia tornò di fori 116 a le cose che son fuor di lei vere, 117 io riconobbi i miei non falsi errori.
query.result:
**English:**
115 When my soul returned outside 116 to the things that are truly outside of it, 117 I recognized my errors, which were not false.
**Cornish:**
115 Pan wrug va eneval dhe dhro dhe-ves 116 dhe'n traowow a yw gwir dhe-ves, 117 my a aswon va kammfosow nag anvougel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Lo duca mio, che mi potea vedere 119 far sì com’ om che dal sonno si slega, 120 disse: «Che hai che non ti puoi tenere,
121 ma se’ venuto più che mezza lega 122 velando li occhi e con le gambe avvolte, 123 a guisa di cui vino o sonno piega?».
query.result:
**English:**
118 My leader, who could see me, 119 acting like someone who is waking up from sleep, 120 said: "What's wrong that you can't control yourself,
121 but have come more than half a league 122 with your eyes covered and your legs wrapped around each other, 123 like someone who is overcome by wine or sleep?".
**Cornish:**
118 An dywgh, a alla ow kovyth gweles, 119 ow tos owth unn den ow tos ow dalleth, 120 a leveris: "Pyth yw, na alla ow tos ow gallos ow tos,
121 mes ow tos ow dos dhe bys hanter an hanter lew, 122 ow tos ow kelmys dha lyga ha'gas dha esow ow tos ow golghys, 123 kepar dhe unn ow tos ow dalleth gans gwin po gans kows?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 «O dolce padre mio, se tu m’ascolte, 125 io ti dirò», diss’ io, «ciò che m’apparve 126 quando le gambe mi furon sì tolte».
query.result:
**English:**
124 "O my sweet father, if you will listen to me, 125 I will tell you," I said, "what appeared to me 126 when my legs were taken from me."
**Cornish:**
124 "O tas ker, mar tus ow klyw, 125 vy a leveris", me a leveris, "pyth a dheuth dhe'm 126 pan wrug an esow ow tos ow kemeres dhe'm."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Ed ei: «Se tu avessi cento larve 128 sovra la faccia, non mi sarian chiuse 129 le tue cogitazion, quantunque parve.
query.result:

**Cornish:**
127 Ha'gas leveris: "Mar tus ow fe an cans larv 128 warbarth dha fas, vy na vythens dhe'm 129 dha dhymmow, kepar ha bosow yns i."

**Cornish:**

139 Noi andavam per lo vespero, attenti 140 oltre quanto potean li occhi allungarsi 141 contra i raggi serotini e lucenti.
query.result:

139 We were walking through the evening, attentive 140 beyond how far the eyes could stretch 141 against the late and shining rays.
**Cornish:**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result:
**English:**
142 And behold, little by little a smoke began to rise 143 toward us, dark as night; 144 nor was there a place to avoid it.
**Cornish:**
142 Ha, weles, bys vyken, un losow a dhalleth 143 dhe’n ughesen orth agan, tywyll avel nos; 144 ha na veu le unn le a dheffens orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Questo ne tolse li occhi e l’aere puro.
query.result:
